   19: %%
   20: -module(trace_call_memory_SUITE).
   21: -author("maximfca@gmail.com").
   22: 
   23: 
   24: %% Test server callbacks
   25: -export([
   26:     suite/0,
   27:     all/0,
   28:     init_per_testcase/2,
   29:     end_per_testcase/2
   30: ]).
   31: 
   32: %% Test cases exports
   33: -export([
   34:     basic/0, basic/1,
   35:     late_trace/0, late_trace/1,
   36:     skip/0, skip/1,
   37:     message/0, message/1,
   38:     parallel_map/0, parallel_map/1,
   39:     trace_all/0, trace_all/1,
   40:     spawn_memory/0, spawn_memory/1, spawn_memory_internal/1,
   41:     spawn_memory_lambda/1,
   42:     conflict_traces/0, conflict_traces/1,
   43:     big_words/0, big_words/1
   44: ]).
   45: 
   46: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   47:     Config.
   48: 
   49: end_per_testcase(basic, _Config) ->
   50:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0}, false, [call_memory]),
   51:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]);
   52: end_per_testcase(late_trace, _Config) ->
   53:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]);
   54: end_per_testcase(skip, _Config) ->
   55:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   56:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]);
   57: end_per_testcase(message, _Config) ->
   58:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, receive_message, 0}, false, [call_memory]),
   59:     erlang:trace(all, false, [call]);
   60: end_per_testcase(parallel_map, _Config) ->
   61:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   62:     erlang:trace(all, false, [call]);
   63: end_per_testcase(trace_all, _Config) ->
   64:     erlang:trace_pattern({'_', '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   65:     erlang:trace(all, false, [call]);
   66: end_per_testcase(spawn_memory, _Config) ->
   67:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   68:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]);
   69: end_per_testcase(spawn_memory_lambda, _Config) ->
   70:     erlang:trace_pattern({erlang, apply, 2}, false, [call_memory]),
   71:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]);
   72: end_per_testcase(conflict_traces, _Config) ->
   73:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, false, [call_memory]),
   74:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]);
   75: end_per_testcase(big_words, _Config) ->
   76:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,alloc_tuples,2}, false, [call_memory]),
   77:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]).
   78: 
   79: 
   80: suite() ->
   81:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 60}}].
   82: 
   83: all() ->
   84:     [basic, late_trace, skip, message, parallel_map, trace_all, spawn_memory,
   85:     spawn_memory_lambda, conflict_traces, big_words].
   86: 
   87: %% allocation functions
   88: alloc_2tup() ->
   89:     {self(),self()}. %% a non literal
   90: 
   91: receive_message() ->
   92:     receive
   93:         Msg -> Msg
   94:     end.
   95: 
   96: basic() ->
   97:     [{doc, "Assert that two-tuple allocated 3-word structure on the heap"}].
   98: 
   99: basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  100:     Self = self(),
  101:     Traced = {?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0},
  102:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  103:     1 = erlang:trace(Self, true, [call]),
  104:     alloc_2tup(),
  105:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 3}]} = erlang:trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  106:     alloc_2tup(),
  107:     {call_memory, [{Self, 2, 6}]} = erlang:trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  108:     %% test that GC works correctly
  109:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  110:     alloc_2tup(),
  111:     {call_memory, [{Self, 3, 9}]} = erlang:trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  112:     1 = erlang:trace(Self, false, [call]),
  113:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  114: 
  115: late_trace() ->
  116:     [{doc, "Tests that garbage_collect call done before tracing is enabled works as expected"}].
  117: 
  118: late_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  119:     Control = self(),
  120:     Pid = spawn_link(
  121:         fun () ->
  122:             _ = late_trace_inner(),
  123:             1 = erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, late_trace_inner, 0}, true, [call_memory]),
  124:             1 = erlang:trace(self(), true, [call]),
  125:             _ = late_trace_inner(),
  126:             Control ! continue,
  127:             receive
  128:                 stop ->
  129:                     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, late_trace_inner, 0}, false, [call_memory])
  130:             end
  131:         end),
  132:     NonLiteral = non_literal_9(),
  133:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  134:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  135:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  136:     receive continue -> ok end,
  137:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 12}]} = erlang:trace_info({?MODULE, late_trace_inner, 0}, call_memory),
  138:     Pid ! stop,
  139:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} -> ok end.
  140: 
  141: late_trace_inner() ->
  142:     Ref = alloc_2tup(), %% 3 words
  143:     receive _Msg -> Ref end. %% 9 more words
  144: 
  145: non_literal_9() ->
  146:     %% 9 words in total: 6 words for the list, 3 for the tuple
  147:     erlang:insert_element(2, erlang:insert_element(1, {}, atom), lists:seq(1, 3)).
  148: 
  149: skip() ->
  150:     [{doc, "Tests that skipped trace for a function accumulates in an upper level caller"}].
  151: 
  152: skip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  153:     Self = self(),
  154:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, upper, 0}, true, [call_memory]),
  155:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, lower, 1}, true, [call_memory]),
  156:     1 = erlang:trace(Self, true, [call]),
  157:     upper(),
  158:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 8 * 2}]} = erlang:trace_info({?MODULE, lower, 1}, call_memory),
  159:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 3 + 3 + 6}]} = erlang:trace_info({?MODULE, upper, 0}, call_memory).
  160: 
  161: upper() ->
  162:     Ref = alloc_2tup(),          %% 3
  163:     X = middle(Ref),            %% 3 in middle, and 8 in lower (but lower has its own accounting)
  164:     {1, 2, 3, X, Ref}.          %% extra 6 words (5 elements and 1 tuple size)
  165: 
  166: middle(_Ref) ->
  167:     Ref2 = alloc_2tup(),         %% 3 - but accounted in 'upper/0' instead
  168:     lower(8),
  169:     Ref2.
  170: 
  171: lower(Max) ->
  172:     lists:seq(1, Max).
  173: 
  174: message() ->
  175:     [{doc, "Assert that receiving a message results in memory trace"}].
  176: 
  177: message(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  178:     Control = self(),
  179:     Traced = {?MODULE, receive_message, 0},
  180:     NonLiteral = non_literal_9(),
  181:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  182:     1 = erlang:trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  183:     Pid = spawn_link(
  184:         fun Wrap() ->
  185:             receive
  186:                 pre ->
  187:                     receive_message(),
  188:                     Control ! done,
  189:                     Wrap();
  190:                 stop ->
  191:                     ok
  192:             end
  193:         end),
  194:     1 = erlang:trace(self(), false, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  195:     %% first, check that sending a (non-matched) message does not result in a negative allocation
  196:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  197:     timer:sleep(500),
  198:     {call_memory, []} = erlang:trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  199:     %% enter the receive_message/0
  200:     Pid ! pre,
  201:     %% wait for 'done' response
  202:     receive done -> ok end,
  203:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 9}]} = erlang:trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  204:     %% once again, just in case, to verify that decrementing "allocated" worked
  205:     Pid ! pre,
  206:     Pid ! NonLiteral,
  207:     receive done -> ok end,
  208:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 2, 18}]} = erlang:trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  209:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  210: 
  211: parallel_map() ->
  212:     [{doc, "Test memory profiling with spawned processes"}].
  213: 
  214: parallel_map(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  215:     _ = erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, true, [call_memory]),
  216:     1 = erlang:trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_spawn]),
  217:     Pid = spawn_link(fun do_parallel/0),
  218:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  219:     Pid ! pre_stop,
  220:     Pid ! {stop, 1},
  221:     receive
  222:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} ->
  223:             %% alloc_2tup called 3 times (once per process)
  224:             {call_memory, [{_, 1, 3}, {_, 1, 3}, {_, 1, 3}]} =
  225:                 erlang:trace_info({?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0}, call_memory),
  226:             %% receive_message called 8 times (3 from "Allocs", 3 from "Grand", and 2 from the runner)
  227:             %%  from 7 processes, but only 3*6 Grand processes and 3 words for the runner are on the heap
  228:             {call_memory, RecvMsg} = erlang:trace_info({?MODULE, receive_message, 0}, call_memory),
  229:             {7, 8, 21} = collapse_procs(RecvMsg)
  230:     end.
  231: 
  232: do_parallel() ->
  233:     Allocs = [spawn_link(fun() -> alloc_2tup(), receive_message() end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 3)],
  234:     Grand = [spawn_link(fun() -> receive_message() end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 3)],
  235:     pre_stop = receive_message(),
  236:     [P ! {atom, <<"1234">>} || P <- Grand], %% 6 words on the heap: 3 for binary, 3 for tuple
  237:     {stop, 1} = receive_message(),
  238:     [exit(P, normal) || P <- Allocs].
  239: 
  240: trace_all() ->
  241:     [{doc, "Enables memory tracing for all processes, mainly ensuring there are no core dumps"}].
  242: 
  243: trace_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  244:     _ = erlang:trace_pattern({'_', '_', '_'}, true, [call_memory]),
  245:     _ = erlang:trace(all, true, [call]),
  246:     do_heavy_lifting(),
  247:     _ = erlang:trace(all, false, [call]),
  248:     Profile = profile_memory(),
  249:     %% it'd be better to introduce more checks, but for now see that
  250:     %%  at least some action happened
  251:     true = is_map_key(application_controller, Profile).
  252: 
  253: do_heavy_lifting() ->
  254:     {ok, []} = application:ensure_all_started(kernel).
  255: 
  256: profile_memory() ->
  257:     profile_modules(code:all_loaded(), #{}).
  258: 
  259: profile_modules([], Acc) ->
  260:     Acc;
  261: profile_modules([{Module, _} | Tail], Acc) ->
  262:     Funcs = try Module:module_info(functions)
  263:             catch error:undef -> [] % ignore homebrewed without module_info
  264:             end,
  265:     case profile_functions(Module, Funcs, #{}) of
  266:         Empty when Empty =:= #{} ->
  267:             profile_modules(Tail, Acc);
  268:         NonEmpty ->
  269:             profile_modules(Tail, Acc#{Module => NonEmpty})
  270:     end.
  271: 
  272: profile_functions(_Module, [], Acc) ->
  273:     Acc;
  274: profile_functions(Module, [{Fun, Arity} | Tail], Acc) ->
  275:     case erlang:trace_info({Module, Fun, Arity}, call_memory) of
  276:         {call_memory, Skip} when Skip =:= []; Skip =:= false ->
  277:             profile_functions(Module, Tail, Acc);
  278:         {call_memory, Mem} ->
  279:             profile_functions(Module, Tail, Acc#{{Fun, Arity} => collapse_procs(Mem)})
  280:     end.
  281: 
  282: collapse_procs(Processes) ->
  283:     lists:foldl(
  284:         fun ({_Pid, Calls, Words}, {Procs, TotCalls, TotWords}) ->
  285:             {Procs + 1, TotCalls + Calls, TotWords + Words}
  286:         end, {0, 0, 0}, Processes).
  287: 
  288: spawn_memory() ->
  289:     [{doc, "Tests that when a process is spawned, initial memory correctly attributed to the initial call"}].
  290: 
  291: spawn_memory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  292:     LostSharing = lists:seq(1, 16),
  293:     _ = erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, 1}, true, [call_memory]),
  294:     1 = erlang:trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  295:     Pid = erlang:spawn_link(?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, [LostSharing]),
  296:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  297:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} -> ok end,
  298:     1 = erlang:trace(self(), false, [all]),
  299:     %% 16-elements list translates into 34-words for spawn
  300:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 34}]} = erlang:trace_info({?MODULE, spawn_memory_internal, 1}, call_memory).
  301: 
  302: spawn_memory_lambda(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  303:     %% check that tracing with context captured through lambda also works - but reports erlang:apply
  304:     LostSharing = lists:seq(1, 16),
  305:     _ = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang, apply, 2}, true, [call_memory]),
  306:     1 = erlang:trace(self(), true, [call, set_on_first_spawn]),
  307:     Pid = erlang:spawn_link(fun () -> spawn_memory_internal(LostSharing) end),
  308:     MRef = monitor(process, Pid),
  309:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} -> ok end,
  310:     1 = erlang:trace(self(), false, [all]),
  311:     %% 16-elements list translates into 34-words for spawn, and 6 more words for apply itself
  312:     {call_memory, [{Pid, 1, 40}]} = erlang:trace_info({erlang, apply, 2}, call_memory).
  313: 
  314: spawn_memory_internal(Array) ->
  315:     Array.
  316: 
  317: conflict_traces() ->
  318:     [{doc, "Verify that call_time and call_memory don't break each other"}].
  319: 
  320: conflict_traces(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  321:     Self = self(),
  322:     Traced = {?MODULE, alloc_2tup, 0},
  323:     %% start call_memory trace
  324:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  325:     1 = erlang:trace(Self, true, [call]),
  326:     alloc_2tup(),
  327:     {call_memory, [{Self, 1, 3}]} = erlang:trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  328:     %% start/stop call_time trace
  329:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_time]),
  330:     alloc_2tup(), %% this goes to both time and memory
  331:     {call_time, [{Self, 1, _, _}]} = erlang:trace_info(Traced, call_time),
  332:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_time]),
  333:     %% memory is unaffected
  334:     alloc_2tup(),
  335:     {call_memory, [{Self, 3, 9}]} = erlang:trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  336:     %%
  337:     1 = erlang:trace(Self, false, [call]),
  338:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  339: 
  340: big_words() ->
  341:     [{doc, "Test that Words counter can be a bignum on 32-bit"}].
  342: 
  343: big_words(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  344:     Self = self(),
  345:     Traced = {?MODULE, alloc_tuples, 2},
  346:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern(Traced, true, [call_memory]),
  347:     1 = erlang:trace(Self, true, [call]),
  348:     Words = (1 bsl 27),
  349:     case {erts_debug:size(Words), 8*erlang:system_info(wordsize)} of
  350:         {2, 32} -> ok;
  351:         {0, 64} -> ok
  352:     end,
  353:     TupleSz = 1023,
  354:     TupleCnt = Words div (TupleSz + 1),
  355:     alloc_tuples(TupleCnt, TupleSz),
  356:     CallCnt = TupleCnt + 1,
  357:     {call_memory, [{Self, CallCnt, Words}]} = erlang:trace_info(Traced, call_memory),
  358:     1 = erlang:trace(Self, false, [call]),
  359:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern(Traced, false, [call_memory]).
  360: 
  361: 
  362: alloc_tuples(0, _) ->
  363:     ok;
  364: alloc_tuples(N, TupleSz) ->
  365:     erlang:make_tuple(TupleSz, []),
  366:     alloc_tuples(N-1, TupleSz).
